zyklone.LEDCloud.patterns

Class WavePattern

  • java.lang.Object
    • zyklone.LEDCloud.patterns.Pattern
      • zyklone.LEDCloud.patterns.LocalPattern
        • zyklone.LEDCloud.patterns.WavePattern

  • public class WavePattern
extends LocalPattern
    This specialization of LocalPattern represents a circular wave like it would be created by a spherical object, dropping into a pool of liquid. The super-classes thickness attribute is used to represent the traveling waves thickness.
    Author:
    Zyklone

    • Constructor Detail

      • WavePattern

        public WavePattern(int pictureSizeX,
                   int pictureSizeY)
        This constructor initializes the Pattern with its default values.
        Parameters:
        pictureSizeX - the length in the x-axis of the led-matrix
        pictureSizeY - the length in the y-axis of the led-matrix

      • WavePattern

        public WavePattern(int pictureSizeX,
                   int pictureSizeY,
                   boolean backgroundPattern)
        This constructor initializes the Pattern with certain default values, depending on if it is part of a BackgroundPattern or not.
        Parameters:
        pictureSizeX - the length in the x-axis of the led-matrix
        pictureSizeY - the length in the y-axis of the led-matrix
        backgroundPattern - true, if this pattern is part of a BackgroundPattern, otherwise false

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        private void initialize()
        Initializes the WavePattern's thickness, velocity and also the x-coordinate of its origin, to not be in the vicinity of either end. The velocity is set to a value dependent on the Patterns lifetime. The longer the lifetime, the lower the velocity.

      • drawPattern

        protected void drawPattern()
        Draws the pattern in the form of a circular wave like it would be created by a spherical object, dropping into a pool of liquid. The thickness attribute is used to represent the thickness of the outwards (from the origin) traveling wave.
        Specified by:
        drawPattern in class LocalPattern

      • getNextPicture

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Color>> getNextPicture()
        Calculates and returns the next picture. The new position of the pattern is dependent on the time passed since the last calculation.
        Overrides:
        getNextPicture in class LocalPattern
        Returns:
        the last calculated picture of this pattern.
